isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (with R-134a Refrigerant System) - SPECIAL TOOLS - FLUSH GUN

svcproc.title: FLUSH GUN
svcproc.para: If the refrigerant system has been contaminated, such as due to an internal compressor failure, it must be flushed and purged before it can be repaired and recharged. A flush gun (refer to Figure 67) is used, along with compressed dry nitrogen, to force a flushing agent through the hoses and components of the refrigerant system. The flush gun and drain hose with compression fitting/adapter can be obtained locally.

warning.para: The nitrogen supplied to the flush gun must not exceed 75 psi.
